com.yantra.api.vas

Interface cancelWorkOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.VASApi, YIFApi

    public interface cancelWorkOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document cancelWorkOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      cancelWorkOrder cancels the work order for the quantity passed in QuantityRemoved.

    • Method Detail

      • cancelWorkOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document cancelWorkOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                     org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                              throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                     java.rmi.RemoteException
        cancelWorkOrder cancels the work order for the quantity passed in QuantityRemoved. If the quantity is not passed then all the quantity remaining (i.e. QuantityAllocated - QuantityCompleted) in the work order will be cancelled.

        When the work order is spawned from an order then upon canceling the work order depending upon the type of the work order following happens

        • MTO work order, then the corresponding order gets unscheduled.
        • PS or DS work order, if all Service Lines are incomplete and all Product Delivery Lines have 0 quantity delivered, work order status will move to CANCEL. Else, it will move to COMPLETE. Also, for Product Delivery Lines where DeliveredQuantity is less than RequestedQuantity and Service Lines where IsComplete=N, their associated Order Line will have the CurrentWorkOrderKey blanked out so that it can be associated with another Work Order.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised:
        Raised under the transaction CANCEL_WORK_ORDER
          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon successful execution of cancelWorkOrder API.
            Data published - VAS_CANCEL_WORK_ORDER.ON_SUCCESS.xml
            Key data - workOrder_dbd.txt
          WORK_ORDER_ACTIVITIES_COMPLETED:
            This event is raised when all the activities involved in the work order are complete as part of cancelWorkOrder API. For example, if a work order is created for quantity '5' and then all activities for quantity '2' are complete, then the call to cancelWorkOrder to cancel the remaining quantity '3' will raise this event.
            Data published - VAS_CANCEL_WORK_ORDER.WORK_ORDER_ACTIVITIES_COMPLETED.xml
            Key data - workOrder_dbd.txt
          ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE:
            This event is raised when an order release status is changed for the order.
            Data published - YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
            Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

        Raised under the transaction CAPACITY_CHANGE
          EXTERNAL_CAPACITY_CHANGE:
            This event is raised when capacity consumptions are changed.
            Data published - YFS_CAPACITY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_CAPACITY_CHANGE.xml
            Template Support: Yes

        Template Support: Yes.

        Audits: Yes

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support:
        Supported for all the elements except:

          WorkOrderComponent
          WorkOrderActivity
          WorkOrderActivityDtl
          Status
          PersonInfo

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains details about the work order cancelled. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
